title: Quiz: Major Plot Types in Seaborn

questions.text: Which Seaborn function is typically used to visualize the distribution of a single numerical variable using bars?
questions.explanation: `sns.histplot()` (or `sns.displot(kind='hist')`) is used to create histograms, which show data distribution.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of `sns.pairplot()`?

options.text: To plot a single time series.
To create detailed box plots for multiple categories.
To visualize pairwise relationships between all numerical columns in a DataFrame.
To generate a heatmap of a correlation matrix.

questions.explanation: `sns.pairplot()` creates a matrix of scatter plots for all pairs of numerical variables and histograms/KDEs on the diagonal.

questions.text: In Seaborn, the `hue` parameter is used to change the overall theme of the plot.
questions.explanation: The `hue` parameter is used to add a third dimension to a plot by coloring points or lines based on the levels of a categorical variable. Themes are set using `sns.set_theme()`.
